vl3VJvcPcQNCDtgn2CTmhg.text: I love Anthony Jr's! My favorite is the meatball calzone and the white pizza. The food is always great. Sometimes the service can be slow tho. I like the deserts too!

kIllSDHSRQW5v3j2_V1kMA.text: Ate at Anthony Jr's tonite for a late dinner. Waitress sucked. Waited 10mins for drinks (water n beer) ordered wedding soup n cheesy bread sticks. Soup was ok, "cheesy bread sticks" was a "pizza without sauce"..greasy bottom crust. When we were done eating we sat for 15mins, then had to go to cash register to pay. Our waitress said she thought she gave us our check. WRONG!! Needless to say she didn't get a tip and we probably won't be going back!!

vH5NTAKT8qsgb5kmCOGdog.text: Good pizza, pleasant family environment.  Friday nights feature a father & son team on guitar and mandolin doing exclusively Italian tunes... Long live Dino!

-0npowdlYbiWkcF-F_RvYQ.text: The steak and meatball calzone is hands down the best you'll ever have.

BdnGzFDb5fWMpmYs8v2gLQ.text: I live up in the hills of Coraopolis near Moon. Anthony Juniors is where the locals go for reliably and consistently good pizza / italian food / strombolis, etc. This is an edited review because I had to give them the fifth star. If you live in the Cor area, AJs is truly the best Italian around, and their pizza is faithfully delicious. Recently I have branched out from pizza and everything I have tried on their menu is excellent.

na3V5B5rsn-Gef2GG5rnCg.text: I manage to get here about once a month.  Would go more if it was closer to me.  Very casual atmosphere. Friendly service. Great pizza and wings.  haven't tried the other pasta dishes.  Full bar service and very inexpensive.  Plenty of seating so reservations are not needed.  Family friendly but you can enjoy a quiet table for two also.  I recommend highly.

5OgjA46nbDe9FLZ6oLlqvg.text: It's been a running joke in my family that we just don't understand how Coraopolis supports so many pizza joints. Some of them come and go rather quickly but Anthony Jr's has been here for as long as I can remember. There are better places to get pizza (I prefer Nicco's which is not far from Anthony's) but AJ's is a nice place to sit down with the family for a pizza or pasta dinner. Recently I've noticed the portions are getting smaller and the prices are going up. I wouldn't recommend the salads as they are heavy on the iceburg lettuce and not heavy on much else. You can get a better salad at McDonald's at this point. The breadsticks are good. The stuffed peppers are GREAT. The pizza is a bit crusty for my taste (I prefer thin crusts) but otherwise good. They have a nice variety of toppings that can be added and always have a ,monthly special, usually some combination of pizza/sandwiches/wings which can sometimes be a real steal. All in all, if you live in the area, there are better places to make your regular pizza place, if you are just visiting and need a quick bite, Anthony Jr's will do.

Ky_r6wYEYFSmqJy5ZP3aAw.text: very good food we got a calzone and it was the size of extra large pizza folded in half we allways have left overs never have had a bad meal here

GCP7T1S7FXSct88bEATL4g.text: Always good food.  We had our normal hand tossed pizza and wings.  The milkshakes are worth the wait.  Plenty of space for groups and a full bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Extra large hand tossed with bacon and 30 hot wings.

OLA6vhEo5HFsuchj7p3QUw.text: This is a typical family Italian/pizzeria type place.  The menu features a variety of pizza and pasta options along with sandwiches and fried appetizers.  Because of the fairly large menu, it is a great place to take a larger group or picky eaters.    The interior is a bit cheesy but yet typical of this type of establishment.  I've been here twice.  Once I ordered a pasta dish.  The pasta bolognese tasted fine but was not what most places would consider a bolognese.  My husband had the lasagna and really enjoyed it.  On another visit we had sandwiches which were decent but nothing memorable.  The wait times did seem to be long compared to the number of people actually in the restaurant.  They also seem to get a bit flustered when there is a large group even when they knew to expect the large group.  Overall a decent dining experience, especially when there isn't a lot of other options in the immediate vicinity.

9Rybo05FOsR5UhKtZsilhA.text: Middle of the road, family style food. The menu is offers a large selection from pastas, pizzas, hoagies, salads, etc. in addition to daily specials. I had the baked cheese ziti and portion was quite large.  It had plenty of cheese (which is a good thing) and salad was large sized.   There are TV's all over the place, so you can watch a movie from any seat in the place.   Staff is friendly and great to talk to.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Hand tossed pepperoni pizza
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Baked cheese ziti (huge portion!)
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Garden salad with blue cheese dressing

1FEWVc3-I1qGc950b7S_jQ.text: Amazing food and sauce... The prices can be very high and Decour is kind a rough.. overall good place! And will go back

f87UsrBWZ7M03Bo80qWs3A.text: I want to preface this with the fact that we do not live near Coraopolis and we do not go out that way much, if at all.  We were meeting up with some family members who were visiting town for a College hockey game at the RMU Island Sports Center, so we sought something nearby.  After we tried one other spot that was takeout only, we ended up here instead.    The place seemed a tad outdated, but other than that, everyone was nice, the service was slow although pleasant and the food was decent.  No complaints other than some of the sandwiches were excessively bready (cut up the meatballs and spread them out a bit for the meatball sub and it is indeed better).  I had the gnocchi and house salad that came with it.  Sauce was good (not my family's sauce but good enough and better than a lot of places), the gnocchi seemed not frozen (I could be wrong), and the house salad was huge for side salad standards.  Loved the Balsamic Vinaigrette that they had too.  My main complaint was the wait time for our food when they were not busy.  Seems like there are a lot of deliveries coming out of there so that must slow the dining in orders down.    If you are ever in this area, and looking for a place to dine, this is a solid choice given the limited options in the area.

b-yGFLcBqMoTRU6RDCUz2A.text: I get delivery from here often. Be cautious, the way they normally prepare some food may not be what you are accustomed to. Great food otherwise. Would recommend to anyone in the area.

u74bFsMFCZsk8rfHDNS_ew.text: Holy portions batman--great family style food. Biggest side salad ever! Staff was helpful and friendly--loads of soda refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Big side salad!!

vyxh8_Rvgo3pdlAqCmk3XA.text: Just getting back from Colorado and having a terrible pizza experience, my family ordered 2 of Anthony's specials and as ALWAYS, it's perfect. Crispy crust on an 18inch pizza, one topping only $1.80, 10 huge juicy chicken tenders for $9.99, nothing greasy (like the terrible Anthony's in Denver. Not at all associated with Anthony Jr's in Coraopolis).  I strongly recommend this place. Dine in or take out. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Love love love.

AeJBCwiRObmj_33D8KhMug.text: The Place: Clean, Casual, Slightly Dive-y, Needs an Update The Service: Helpful, Friendly  The Food: Good Sized Portions The Cost: $10.00 +/- a dish  There is nothing fancy about Jr's, but you're eating the food, not the decor! Big Portions, Cheap, Flavorful, Great Pizza!!! My brother is a HUGE fan of the Stuff Banana Peppers  Anytime I'm in town, I make sure to stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Front of Restaurant
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Gnocchi w/ Meatballs
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Stuff Banana Peppers

vGj6PgSoiWmF3USXXolNYQ.text: I have eaten here a number of times.   The staff has always been very attentive,  food is enough for two meals Ann's i always take half home.  They have the BEST garlic bread around.  The sauce is tall and can't be from a can.  They will sell you a quart to take home too.  At Christmas they have a Verdi nice display in the window.  Reminds me of my childhood when everybody would go out for Christmas.   I haven't had the pizza but people at my wife's work day out is the best around. Personally, I  can't pass up the chicken parmesan.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Parking lot across the street if needed.  25 cents an hour.

oWzr6im-ajpbHBhyz7Wifg.text: Great place, good service, large servings and reasonably priced.  You might even run into Frank Sinatra on a Saturday night.

3LowRDyr8m5S-VC6fXuwrg.text: Always get catering from these guys and its second to none! Delicious pizza as well as restaurant options -- a great family staple

XETN_LxRv1oZSvHc6OKrhQ.text: Went with friends on their recommendation.  Based on appearances we we apprehensive but once you got a whiff of the cooking I knew we were in a good place. The pasta dishes we had were marvelous. I highly recommend the place.  Actually it's worth the drive just for a great meal.

4YArqhnQCn-8Ok2t-ooSOQ.text: This was the worst experience I've had there. Although it was a busy Friday there was a couple that was there way before my husband and I and we got our food first. I mentioned this to my waitress and a little bit later their food came. My waitress was not their waitress. As I left I asked to speak with the manager and he would not come out to speak with me, which I found out was Anthony the owner. The couple was too afraid to say anything so I took it upon myself to do so. The manager or hostess would not do or say anything about it just that they were busy. Plus I overheard the waitress tell them that it takes longer for the fish. NO she forgot their order and would not own up to her mistake. The other waitress was very rude as well and would not help. I told the couple to complain but I doubt if they did. Horrible service especially from an owner that should try to be accommodating to his customers. Don't believe I will be going back!!!!!!

ucIxI1hYAsyXti5qdgtt6A.text: These people should be ashamed of the food that they sell. I mean really ashamed. & if a customer asks for a small side of greek dressing i would say just toss the eye droppers worth of dressing in the foil wrapper.   Never mind the dressing though just cause the food is so schwag that the thought of eating anything from there even if the "food" were free I wouldn't give it to my dog.  i would say to anyone in dire straights that needs to eat in Coraopolis to suck it up and drive to Pirmanti Bros (also in Coraopolis)  becuase the food at Anthony Jr's is straight butt.

9AVWrH3PTgKSehSITVaehQ.text: We are new to the area and had heard a lot about Anthony Jrs from friends in the area, so we decided to give it a try.   I'll tell you just why I have it 5 stars. 1. We were promptly greeted by our server when heading to their bar area, who was extremely friendly. We mentioned we were new to the area and she let us know about the menu and the best things to order. Always good when your given suggestions. 2. There wasn't much going on for just a lunch shift which was completely okay with me. Our server was prompt with everything. Refilling our drinks and delivering our food in a timely fashion. 3. The food was DELICIOUS! We took our servers recommendation of hoagies and piZza. I got the house salad (huge portion) and we shared potato skins (which were home made with real bacon and potatoes!) we both got steal hoagies and my boyfriend got a small buffalo chicken pizza. Everything was so good and seemed fresh.  We will definitely be back!!!! Great job Anthony's keep it up!!!!

FlCIykWp0IGYoJYHyS-k3g.text: I have been enjoying Anthony Jr's for over a decade and really love dining in. It's family style dining area brings memories of Gram Ma's house.

I6KscPpQYNhpcSjl1-cnpw.text: We've done carryout once and delivery tonight - pizza is solid here both times. When we did carryout, it wasn't all that hot when we got it home. Don't know how long it was sitting there before we picked it up. Still tasted great, but could have been much better right out of the oven.  I was willing to give them another shot and we did delivery tonight.  And my whole family was so glad that we gave them another chance!  Pizza was even better this time with the pizza relatively piping hot from the delivery guy bringing it to our house.  This time, I also ordered a steak calzone. This thing is ENORMOUS! It was in a pizza box and my wife thought they accidentally gave us another pizza instead of the calzone. But no, it's a calzone the size of a pizza. For $12, it's a great deal and it can feed 2-3 people very easily.  Steak calzone includes hot peppers, thin steak, pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms and onions. A little too much sauce for me, but wow is this thing enormous and delicious!

o-c1gwGltvVaAS2i1Hpnpg.text: waited 30 minutes for 2 sandwiches with fry's.  table next to us came in after us and got their food before us.  owner must be trying to save money because no pickles came with either sandwich.  how cheap!   Don't order the "homemade" cookie....it is NOT homemade and came wrapped in plastic wrap.... how tacky!  We waited and waited and waited for our check.   Don't think they roast the turkey here as the server said... tasted and looked real cheap... terrible choice for a Saturday night out.

H9zE-h1WPEpOHH4R9sJA0A.text: Food was pretty good.  The waitress had a bitchy attitude from the get go, but we went ahead and found the humor in it.  It's a good place to eat.

NBRgQO3PVb1t3SmDRhlWFw.text: A wonderful atmosphere and great food. Loved the bathrooms, and the view of streetlight from the window really keeps the visit interesting

saaAXPhAXEqcVdzDJaVT0Q.text: This is NOT the place I remember. Wow, how are they even still in business?? It has gone down hill considerably in every way imaginable. The service was so bad that I am not sure I can find the words to describe it without using vulgarity. Hey if I did that at least I would be on par with the attitude of the employees. Ok, let's put aside the bad service for a minute and talk about the food.  The pizza that I once loved was like chewing through a blackened cinder block. It was burnt like nobody's business (my complaints fell of deaf ears), chewy and the sauce was so bitter and sour.  I guess that saying about never being able to go home again is True in this case. Blah.

rsMkmz8fij7Bd_O4f_4N6g.text: I have been a customer for decades. That ends today. I ordered a jumbo supreme pizza - I read it from the text message my husband sent me. No mistakes. This is what my 77 year old husband wanted as his last meal before major heart by-pass surgery. I picked the pizza up and got home at 8:00 pm to find a jumbo CHEESE pizza. I called and they claim it is my mistake because the order taker SAYS he read it back to me.  Anthony's was unwilling to do anything without charging me for a supreme pizza. It's 8 PM - too late to go back out. The order totaled over $40 and we have spent THOUSANDS over the years ! VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!

ZeNacHOseJCAmli6jw0Ysg.text: We go to this restaurant for all of our family birthdays or other get-togethers. The food is always good. I've had pizza, calzone, wraps, fish and a variety of sandwiches. You get plenty of food and will probably take home a doggy bag.

on94yH35n_uGIihr0Hk8PQ.text: Came here on 6/3/19 at 9:20pm. They absolutely didn't want me to dine in for some reason. The woman was acting like I got there 1 minute before closing she went to the kitchen to ask. Not sure why. It says that they close at 11pm. Anyway I just leaved.

ukW9qbm4amnAPWe9xx68JA.text: We went in here the sign said open but no one was around. We figured they were busy or something so we sat ourselves up front at the bar near the entrance to the kitchen and waited five minutes. There was a lot of talking behind the doors but no one came out. Not one Erwin came out. Am sorely disappointed.

lsTKzcHy8nKcwqbYgP-CJg.text: The place is run down but that doesn't deter me- sometimes those turn out to be diamonds in the rough. But not this time. I ordered the Anthony Jrs Special Sandwich. The meat was old and dry, not the piece of steak I expected. The slaw was basically dry, chopped cabbage and the fries were under cooked. The best part of the whole meal was the seasoned oil that came on the side- it was delicious.  The server was good and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States

77tC3syMLuxTO8-_bZqIRA.text: Have eaten here many times and have also done Take Out .  Food is always good and Portions are Generous, Italian Hoagie, Pizza w PEPPERONI, or Chicken Finger Basket are my Choices when I go there

gUvpgZ7UWR_eB5ZFDwmxXA.text: Stacy did a great job as our server. We had Cheesy Baked Ziti and a Caprese Hoagie. The ziti portion is huge. You can eat 3 times from it. The salad was huge. Garlic bread was delicious. The men's room was exceptionally clean. Great experience as always!

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States

ELwAOhEGVG8qRt4qcg93rg.text: One of my  Coraopolis favorites. Service is great, food is hot and good and not to expensive.

xKyCM8NlgaqWmfFiRCYpGw.text: Food is great and reasonably priced. Staff is friendly. The decor could use some updating, and parking can be a little tricky. But the food is worth it!

pnTF760x2yVSJQPU35pckg.text: Very disappointing experience.  I drove with my son nearly 15 miles to eat here, remembering it as a great place with good food.  Instead, the wait was too long, my soup wasn't hot, the BLT was just passable and the service was horrible.  When I pointed out these deficiencies to the waitress Sadie), she became defensive and downright hostile.  She returned the bill and my credit card by literally throwing it at me without a simple apology for the whole experience.  With so many places to eat, don't waste your time visiting this place.

HOkQRU69wNF13vg0S9NvTQ.text: We went here for the first time and just ordered off the lunch special menu. They give several selections for 8.99. I had soup and salad. The salad was mostly ice berg lettuce with a few toppings and the wedding soup was just alright. My son had the 4 cut pizza. He enjoyed it. I'd give this place another try....maybe I'd try the pasta next time.

AGLIq92CkhDzf6qz1PQk7Q.text: Wow! Nice performance. Ordered delivery tonight. Driver was almost 15 minutes early. My hand tossed veggie pizza was fresh, hot and delicious. Veggies were divine and the crust needs a special mention. It was obviously hand tossed and not overworked, leaving it pleasantly chewy and tasty. I lived in Brooklyn and made pizza in high school. This pizza is the real deal.

i4spSyAQX5zJ6qluL3cFpw.text: ...tried to go this week, but they were closed. Sign on the door said they will reopen on July 11. Sign also said that they will now be a cash only establishment. A death knell...

XpdQ79czlxII7BT6mMH1yw.text: I have been coming here for about 10 years and it's reliably good. The service is always prompt and the waitresses are nice and helpful, but not in your face, which is what I prefer.  The wedding soup is delicious and the bread sticks are my favorite of anywhere -- crispy on the outside but not hard and smothered in parmasean and butter. All of the pastas are tasty and the portions are very large. My BF wanted penne alla vodka, their vodka sauce is all white but they offered to mix some red in with him since that's what he was craving and everything is made to order.   I had a sausage calzone and WOW - it was HUGE. Easily enough for 5-6 meals for me. It looked like an extra large pizza folded in half! It was really tasty and was just as good for lunch the next day.   It's not "cheap" but you certainly get what you pay for in quality and quantity. Our bill was approximately $40 for two people with an appetizer, sodas and two huge portions of food.

9N7yRn4VVBKUrhCaw7wRXA.text: Food was decent, but not the best in Pittsburgh. Portions are huge. The Calzone would feed a medium sized family.  Beer selection is pedestrian at best. They are missing the boat here.  Pizza was ok. Wedding soup was good. In Pittsburgh that's big. Calzone was good and huge. Fish was also good.  Sub was very good. Italian Superheroes.   Service was very poor, and incredibly slow. On a Monday in July.  Sicilian pizza was also huge, and good. Thin crust large was ok. Dough was passable. Sauce bland. Cheese good. Passable, but not the best by a far cry.  The bright spot was wedding soup. In Pittsburgh that is big, as there is a lot of good wedding soup here.     There is so much excellent pizza in this town. This does not rate among them. Craft beer is so popular now. To not even sell Sam Adams in bottles is a travesty. This place markets as a higher end pizza spot. With low end beer choices, and poor service, there are so many choices near here. Not horrible, but average. Not worth going out of your way. I travelled 15 miles to try. Will likely not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Sub sandwich
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States

G-EPaWCKEBOQ_t2MLtcIIg.text: Really good Italian food; pasta, pizza, hoagies etc. French fries were excellent. Large dining room. Very good for families. Was there with a large party and the service was really good.

Y3L9wyJjyg13sNOJrMciKQ.text: wow wow wow!   this place is incredible. I normally don't do Italian restaurant... cause NOBODY cooks better than my Italian grandma could. And most Italian restaurants these days have been americanized.   I was told to get the calzone. My sister ordered the pasta which was very good. The price for the calzone seemed a bit high for a typical calzone, but that didn't matter to me. I ordered it.   Then it came to my table. HUGE! Half as tall as me this calzone. And filled with all sorts. Of course I was unable to eat it all and took me 2 days to finish it off.   So no matter what you order here, you'll need a doggie bag or share a plate with someone. Really... portions are giant!  But outside of the food, they have this lovely Italian group that come in and play giving it a real Italian feel. And they play the mouse song my Italian family played when I was young.   Really a lovely restaurant!  PS: this was one of the many restaurants that have attributed to my few extra pounds I gained in my 2 weeks in Pittsburgh. American food is YUM! Going to gym! ha ha

photos.caption: Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Good music
Photo of Anthony Jr's Restaurant & Pizzeria - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Seriously huge

MwjEzIufCsZAETz0JtdI8w.text: Got takeout from here utilizing their online coupons. June monthly special was XL cheese pizza, 1 wings, steak hoagie and breadsticks for $24.99....CANNOT beat that! Pizza is good, crust is nice & doughy, wings had great flavor & weren't soggy. Inside could use some updating, but doesn't bother me.
